text.p: Microleague Multimedia Inc said on Monday that it signed a letter of intent to acquire KidSoft LLC, a distributor of children's multimedia education and entertainment software headquartered in Cupertino, Calif.
Microleague said it will acquire KidSoft for $11 million in unregistered Microleague Multimedia common stock, plus warrants to purchase 325,000 shares of Microleague stock.

Also, The Hearst Corp and Ameritech Corp, major shareholders in KidSoft, will purchase shares of Microleague stock in a private placement, Microleague said. The transaction is expected to close within 30 days.
The acquisition of KidSoft, with 1996 revenues of $9.5 million, is expected to significantly increase MMI's revenues and market share in family-oriented software, Microleague said.
Microleague conducted its initial public offering in May of 1996.

A Microleague spokesman said the terms of the private placement with Ameritech and Hearst will total about $2 million and the number of shares involved in the offering will be based on the company's average market price for each share.
